messages.message: I try to only use it for stuff that is probably of general interest, so that people don’t have to drill down into each slack thread to see if there’s something they might want to know (I hate slack threads). But I’ll try to be more temperate in my judgement…

hm… fair point. i’ve found it typically hard to really understand the comment that is “sent to channel” unless i drill down into the slack thread anyways (for the full context). + usually the initial message being replied to gives me an idea of “do i care about the information being percolated out”.
but there’s definitely times when doing so is useful.
Yeah. In this case the initial message was “does this mean what I think it means”, which… ¯\_(ツ)_/¯ :smile:
